channel.title: Linux on Hsin-Yu Chen

item.title: Install PXE Server
item.description: Introduction Preboot Execution Environment(PXE) is a client-server interface that allows computers in a network to be booted from the server before deploying the obtained PC image in local and remote offices, for PXE enabled clients. PXE network boot is performed using client-server protocols like DHCP(Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) and TFTP(Trivial File Transfer Protocol). PXE will be enabled by default on all computers. PXE Boot Components (1) PXE-capable Network Interface Controller (NIC)

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description: ENV : OS : Ubuntu 18.04 Desktop Hugo : v0.93.0 What is Hugo ? Hugo is a fast and modern static site generator written in Go, and designed to make website creation fun again. (Notes : More Hugo introduction, please see hugo website.) Hugo has many installation methods, including Windows/macOS/Linux. Now, we will show you how to install in Linux. Please Follow the following steps:
